title: Roots
description: Strengthen your roots for stability and grounding. Like a tree anchored in rich earth, you are nourished by what you return to again and again—values, practices, and people who help you feel steady.
prompts: What practices or people help you feel most grounded?
Where do you need deeper roots before you grow higher?
action: Place both feet on the floor. Breathe slowly for 60 seconds and picture roots growing from your soles into the earth.

title: Soil
description: Tend the soil of your life so new intentions can take root. Nourish your body, mind, and spirit with inputs that enrich you, and clear what depletes you.
prompts: What enriches your 'inner soil' right now?
What depletion can you remove or reduce this week?
action: Choose one nourishing input today (rest, water, movement, wholesome food) and schedule it like an appointment.

title: Foundation
description: Build a reliable base for growth. Consistent, simple habits create stability so your bigger dreams can stand tall.
prompts: Which small habit most supports your wellbeing?
What wobbly area needs shoring up?
action: Pick one 5-minute habit to repeat daily this week (stretching, journaling, one glass of water on waking).

title: Water
description: Offer yourself steady nourishment. As water sustains a garden, regular care sustains your growth—physically, emotionally, spiritually.
prompts: Where are you thirsty for care or attention?
What drip-by-drip practice would restore you?
action: Sip a calming tea slowly. With each swallow, repeat:

title: Sunlight
description: Invite warmth and light. Choose perspectives, places, and people that help you photosynthesize hope into energy.
prompts: What brings light into your day?
Where could you step out of the shade and be seen?
action: Spend 3 minutes in natural light. Turn your face toward it and take 10 slow breaths.

title: Nurture
description: Tend gently to what you want to grow—your body, your work, your relationships. Care is not a detour; it is the path.
prompts: What do you most want to nurture this month?
How can you make care feel simple and repeatable?
action: Write one loving note—to yourself or someone dear—and place it somewhere it will be found.

title: Seedling
description: Honor tender beginnings. Protect your new idea or habit with patience and small, consistent steps.
prompts: What is sprouting in your life right now?
What boundary would protect this tender start?
action: Name one tiny step you can take in the next 24 hours to support your seedling—and do only that.

title: Bloom
description: Allow your true colors to shine. Blooming isn't perfection—it's presence. Express yourself as you are, where you are.
prompts: Where are you ready to be more visible?
What unique quality wants to be celebrated?
action: Share something you made or believe—in a post, a call, or a note to a friend.

title: Expand
description: Widen your horizons. Say yes to opportunities that stretch you while staying aligned with your values.
prompts: What invitation feels expansive (and a little brave)?
Where can you create more room—time, space, or support?
action: Make one outreach today (email, message, application) that opens a door.

title: Prune
description: Release what no longer serves so energy can return to what matters. Cutting back is an act of devotion to your future growth.
prompts: What habit or commitment is draining you?
What could you lovingly say no to this week?
action: Choose one low-return obligation to pause or cancel. Reclaim that time for rest or focus.

title: Compost
description: Transform past challenges into rich wisdom. Nothing is wasted—experience breaks down and feeds the next season.
prompts: What difficult experience holds hidden nutrients?
What lesson is ready to feed your next step?

title: Renew
description: Step into fresh possibility. After release, renewal arrives—subtle at first, then steady. Welcome the new with gentleness.
prompts: What wants to begin again—in a simpler way?
Which small ritual will mark your fresh start?
action: Change something symbolic today (fresh sheets, cleaned desk, a new route) to signal renewal.
